Coordinate projections are convex on ^ sorry : Type^Unknown identifier `n`n.

lemma convexFunctionOn_coord {n : Nat} (j : Fin n) : ConvexFunctionOn (S := (Set.univ : Set (Fin n Real))) (fun x => (x j : EReal)) := by refine (convexFunctionOn_iff_segment_inequality (C := (Set.univ : Set (Fin n Real))) (f := fun x => (x j : EReal)) (hC := convex_univ) ?_).2 ?_ intro x hx exact EReal.coe_ne_bot (x j) intro x hx y hy t ht0 ht1 have hleft : ((1 - t) x + t y) j = (1 - t) * x j + t * y j := by simp [smul_eq_mul] have hright : ((1 - t : Real) : EReal) * (x j : EReal) + ((t : Real) : EReal) * (y j : EReal) = (( (1 - t) * x j + t * y j : Real) : EReal) := by calc ((1 - t : Real) : EReal) * (x j : EReal) + ((t : Real) : EReal) * (y j : EReal) = (( (1 - t) * x j : Real) : EReal) + (( t * y j : Real) : EReal) := by rfl _ = (( (1 - t) * x j + t * y j : Real) : EReal) := by simp [EReal.coe_add] calc (fun x => (x j : EReal)) ((1 - t) x + t y) = (( (1 - t) * x j + t * y j : Real) : EReal) := by simp [hleft] _ ((1 - t : Real) : EReal) * (x j : EReal) + ((t : Real) : EReal) * (y j : EReal) := by simp

Pulling out a positive scalar from a finite supremum in EReal : TypeEReal.

lemma iSup_mul_of_pos {n : Nat} (a : Fin n EReal) {t : Real} (ht : 0 < t) : ( j, (t : EReal) * a j) = (t : EReal) * j, a j := by classical refine le_antisymm ?_ ?_ refine iSup_le ?_ intro j have hj : a j j, a j := le_iSup (fun j => a j) j exact ereal_mul_le_mul_of_pos_left_general (t := t) ht hj have htinv : 0 < t := inv_pos.mpr ht have hleinv : ( j, (t : EReal) * ((t : EReal) * a j)) (t : EReal) * j, (t : EReal) * a j := by refine iSup_le ?_ intro j have hj : (t : EReal) * a j j, (t : EReal) * a j := le_iSup (fun j => (t : EReal) * a j) j exact ereal_mul_le_mul_of_pos_left_general (t := t) htinv hj have hle0 : ( j, a j) j, (t : EReal) * ((t : EReal) * a j) := by refine iSup_le ?_ intro j have hcancel : a j = (t : EReal) * ((t : EReal) * a j) := by symm calc (t : EReal) * ((t : EReal) * a j) = (t : EReal) * ((t : EReal) * a j) := by simp [mul_left_comm] _ = a j := by simpa [mul_assoc] using (ereal_mul_inv_smul (t := t) ht (x := a j)) calc a j = (t : EReal) * ((t : EReal) * a j) := hcancel _ j, (t : EReal) * ((t : EReal) * a j) := by exact le_iSup (fun j => (t : EReal) * ((t : EReal) * a j)) j have hle' : ( j, a j) (t : EReal) * j, (t : EReal) * a j := le_trans hle0 hleinv have hmul := ereal_mul_le_mul_of_pos_left_general (t := t) ht hle' simpa [ereal_mul_inv_smul (t := t) ht (x := j, (t : EReal) * a j)] using hmul

Components of a vector form a bounded-above set.

The standard basis vector lies in the simplex.

lemma simplex_stdBasis_mem {n : Nat} (j : Fin n) : ( i, 0 ((Pi.single j (1 : )) : Fin n ) i) (Finset.univ.sum (fun i => ((Pi.single j (1 : )) : Fin n ) i) = 1) := by classical refine And.intro ?_ ?_ intro i by_cases h : i = j subst h; simp simp [Pi.single_eq_of_ne h] have hsum : Finset.univ.sum (fun i : Fin n => ((Pi.single j (1 : )) : Fin n ) i) = ((Pi.single j (1 : )) : Fin n ) j := by refine Finset.sum_eq_single (s := Finset.univ) (a := j) (f := fun i : Fin n => ((Pi.single j (1 : )) : Fin n ) i) ?_ ?_ intro b hb hbj simp [Pi.single_eq_of_ne hbj] intro h exact (False.elim (h (Finset.mem_univ j))) simp [hsum]

A convex combination of components is bounded by their supremum.

lemma dotProduct_le_sSup_components_of_simplex {n : Nat} (x y : Fin n ) (hy0 : j, 0 y j) (hysum : Finset.univ.sum (fun j => y j) = 1) : dotProduct x y sSup { r : | j : Fin n, r = x j } := by classical let Sx : Set := { r : | j : Fin n, r = x j } have hbd : BddAbove Sx := bddAbove_components (x := x) have hxle : j, x j sSup Sx := by intro j exact le_csSup hbd j, rfl have hsum_le : Finset.univ.sum (fun j => x j * y j) Finset.univ.sum (fun j => sSup Sx * y j) := by refine Finset.sum_le_sum ?_ intro j hj exact mul_le_mul_of_nonneg_right (hxle j) (hy0 j) have hsum_eq : Finset.univ.sum (fun j => sSup Sx * y j) = sSup Sx * Finset.univ.sum (fun j => y j) := by simpa using (Finset.mul_sum (s := Finset.univ) (f := fun j => y j) (a := sSup Sx)).symm calc dotProduct x y = Finset.univ.sum (fun j => x j * y j) := by simp [dotProduct] _ Finset.univ.sum (fun j => sSup Sx * y j) := hsum_le _ = sSup Sx * Finset.univ.sum (fun j => y j) := hsum_eq _ = sSup Sx := by simp [hysum]

Each component is bounded by the support function of the simplex.

lemma component_le_supportFunction_simplex {n : Nat} (x : Fin n ) (j : Fin n) : x j supportFunction { y : Fin n Real | ( j, 0 y j) (Finset.univ.sum (fun j => y j) = 1) } x := by classical let C : Set (Fin n ) := { y : Fin n | ( j, 0 y j) (Finset.univ.sum (fun j => y j) = 1) } have hbd : BddAbove { r : | y C, r = dotProduct x y } := by refine sSup { r : | j : Fin n, r = x j }, ?_ intro r hr rcases hr with y, hyC, rfl rcases hyC with hy0, hysum exact dotProduct_le_sSup_components_of_simplex (x := x) (y := y) hy0 hysum have hmem : x j { r : | y C, r = dotProduct x y } := by have hCmem : ((Pi.single j (1 : )) : Fin n ) C := by simp [C, simplex_stdBasis_mem] refine (Pi.single j (1 : )), hCmem, ?_ simp exact le_csSup hbd hmem

Text 5.5.0.3: The function Unknown identifier `f`f which assigns to each the greatest of the components Unknown identifier `xi_j`xi_j of Unknown identifier `x`x is the support function of the simplex .

lemma supportFunction_simplex_eq_maxComponent {n : Nat} : let C : Set (Fin n Real) := { y : Fin n Real | ( j, 0 y j) (Finset.univ.sum (fun j => y j) = 1) } supportFunction C = fun x => sSup { r : | j : Fin n, r = x j } := by classical cases n with | zero => funext x simp [supportFunction] | succ n => funext x let C : Set (Fin (Nat.succ n) Real) := { y : Fin (Nat.succ n) Real | ( j, 0 y j) (Finset.univ.sum (fun j => y j) = 1) } let Sx : Set := { r : | j : Fin (Nat.succ n), r = x j } have hle : supportFunction C x sSup Sx := by have hCne : C.Nonempty := by refine (Pi.single (0 : Fin (Nat.succ n)) (1 : )), ?_ simpa [C] using (simplex_stdBasis_mem (j := (0 : Fin (Nat.succ n)))) have hne : Set.Nonempty { r : | y C, r = dotProduct x y } := by rcases hCne with y, hyC exact dotProduct x y, y, hyC, rfl refine csSup_le hne ?_ intro r hr rcases hr with y, hyC, rfl rcases hyC with hy0, hysum simpa [Sx] using (dotProduct_le_sSup_components_of_simplex (x := x) (y := y) hy0 hysum) have hge : sSup Sx supportFunction C x := by have hneSx : Sx.Nonempty := by refine x (0 : Fin (Nat.succ n)), (0 : Fin (Nat.succ n)), rfl refine csSup_le hneSx ?_ intro r hr rcases hr with j, rfl simpa [C] using (component_le_supportFunction_simplex (x := x) (j := j)) exact le_antisymm hle hge

Absolute values of components form a bounded-above set.

lemma bddAbove_abs_components {n : Nat} (x : Fin n ) : BddAbove { r : | j : Fin n, r = |x j| } := by simpa using (bddAbove_components (x := fun j => |x j|))

Componentwise absolute value bound for convex combinations.

lemma abs_component_le_convexCombo {n : Nat} (x y : Fin n ) {a b : } (ha : 0 a) (hb : 0 b) (j : Fin n) : |((a x + b y) j)| a * |x j| + b * |y j| := by have h1 : |a * x j| = a * |x j| := by calc |a * x j| = |a| * |x j| := by simp _ = a * |x j| := by simp [abs_of_nonneg ha] have h2 : |b * y j| = b * |y j| := by calc |b * y j| = |b| * |y j| := by simp _ = b * |y j| := by simp [abs_of_nonneg hb] calc |((a x + b y) j)| = |a * x j + b * y j| := by simp [smul_eq_mul] _ |a * x j| + |b * y j| := by simpa using (abs_add_le (a * x j) (b * y j)) _ = a * |x j| + b * |y j| := by simp [h1, h2]

The set of absolute component values is nonempty in positive dimension.

lemma abs_components_nonempty_succ {n : Nat} (x : Fin (Nat.succ n) ) : Set.Nonempty { r : | j : Fin (Nat.succ n), r = |x j| } := by refine |x (0 : Fin (Nat.succ n))|, ?_ exact 0, rfl

Dot product bound for vectors in the l1-ball.

lemma dotProduct_le_sSup_abs_components_of_l1Ball {n : Nat} (x y : Fin n ) (hy : Finset.univ.sum (fun j => |y j|) 1) : dotProduct x y sSup { r : | j : Fin n, r = |x j| } := by classical let Sx : Set := { r : | j : Fin n, r = |x j| } have hbd : BddAbove Sx := bddAbove_abs_components (x := x) have hsum_le_abs : Finset.univ.sum (fun j => x j * y j) Finset.univ.sum (fun j => |x j| * |y j|) := by refine Finset.sum_le_sum ?_ intro j hj have : x j * y j |x j * y j| := le_abs_self (x j * y j) calc x j * y j |x j * y j| := this _ = |x j| * |y j| := by simp [abs_mul] have hxle : j, |x j| sSup Sx := by intro j exact le_csSup hbd j, rfl have hsum_le : Finset.univ.sum (fun j => |x j| * |y j|) Finset.univ.sum (fun j => sSup Sx * |y j|) := by refine Finset.sum_le_sum ?_ intro j hj exact mul_le_mul_of_nonneg_right (hxle j) (abs_nonneg (y j)) have hsum_eq : Finset.univ.sum (fun j => sSup Sx * |y j|) = sSup Sx * Finset.univ.sum (fun j => |y j|) := by simpa using (Finset.mul_sum (s := Finset.univ) (f := fun j => |y j|) (a := sSup Sx)).symm have hnonneg : 0 sSup Sx := by by_cases hne : Sx.Nonempty rcases hne with r, j, rfl have : 0 |x j| := abs_nonneg (x j) exact le_trans this (le_csSup hbd j, rfl) have hSx : Sx = := (Set.not_nonempty_iff_eq_empty).1 hne simp [hSx] calc dotProduct x y = Finset.univ.sum (fun j => x j * y j) := by simp [dotProduct] _ Finset.univ.sum (fun j => |x j| * |y j|) := hsum_le_abs _ Finset.univ.sum (fun j => sSup Sx * |y j|) := hsum_le _ = sSup Sx * Finset.univ.sum (fun j => |y j|) := hsum_eq _ sSup Sx * 1 := by exact mul_le_mul_of_nonneg_left hy hnonneg _ = sSup Sx := by simp

A single-coordinate vector with bounded absolute value lies in the l1-ball.

lemma l1Ball_single_mem {n : Nat} (j : Fin n) (s : ) (hs : |s| 1) : (Pi.single j s : Fin n ) { y : Fin n | Finset.univ.sum (fun i => |y i|) 1 } := by classical have hsum : Finset.univ.sum (fun i : Fin n => |((Pi.single j s) : Fin n ) i|) = |((Pi.single j s) : Fin n ) j| := by refine Finset.sum_eq_single (s := Finset.univ) (a := j) (f := fun i : Fin n => |((Pi.single j s) : Fin n ) i|) ?_ ?_ intro b hb hbj simp [Pi.single_eq_of_ne hbj] intro h exact (False.elim (h (Finset.mem_univ j))) simpa [hsum] using hs

Each absolute component is bounded by the support function of the l1-ball.

lemma abs_component_le_supportFunction_l1Ball {n : Nat} (x : Fin n ) (j : Fin n) : |x j| supportFunction { y : Fin n Real | Finset.univ.sum (fun j => |y j|) 1 } x := by classical let D : Set (Fin n ) := { y : Fin n | Finset.univ.sum (fun j => |y j|) 1 } let Sx : Set := { r : | j : Fin n, r = |x j| } have hbd : BddAbove { r : | y D, r = dotProduct x y } := by refine sSup Sx, ?_ intro r hr rcases hr with y, hyD, rfl have hyD' : Finset.univ.sum (fun j => |y j|) 1 := by simpa [D] using hyD simpa [Sx] using (dotProduct_le_sSup_abs_components_of_l1Ball (x := x) (y := y) (hy := hyD')) let s : := if 0 x j then 1 else -1 let y : Fin n := Pi.single j s have hyD : y D := by have hs : |s| 1 := by by_cases h : 0 x j simp [s, h] simp [s, h] simpa [D, y] using (l1Ball_single_mem (j := j) (s := s) hs) have hmem : |x j| { r : | y D, r = dotProduct x y } := by refine y, hyD, ?_ by_cases h : 0 x j simp [y, s, h, abs_of_nonneg h] have hneg : x j < 0 := lt_of_not_ge h simp [y, s, h, abs_of_neg hneg] exact le_csSup hbd hmem

Text 5.5.0.4: The function is convex in ^ sorry : Type^Unknown identifier `n`n.

lemma convexOn_maxAbsComponent {n : Nat} : ConvexOn (Set.univ : Set (Fin n Real)) (fun x => sSup { r : | j : Fin n, r = |x j| }) := by classical cases n with | zero => have hfun : (fun x : Fin 0 => sSup { r : | j : Fin 0, r = |x j| }) = fun _ => (0 : ) := by funext x simp simpa [hfun] using (convexOn_const (s := (Set.univ : Set (Fin 0 Real))) (c := (0 : )) convex_univ) | succ n => refine convex_univ, ?_ intro x hx y hy a b ha hb hab let Sxy : Set := { r : | j : Fin (Nat.succ n), r = |(a x + b y) j| } let Sx : Set := { r : | j : Fin (Nat.succ n), r = |x j| } let Sy : Set := { r : | j : Fin (Nat.succ n), r = |y j| } have hbdx : BddAbove Sx := bddAbove_abs_components (x := x) have hbdy : BddAbove Sy := bddAbove_abs_components (x := y) have hne : Sxy.Nonempty := abs_components_nonempty_succ (x := a x + b y) have hle : sSup Sxy a * sSup Sx + b * sSup Sy := by refine csSup_le hne ?_ intro r hr rcases hr with j, rfl have hxj : |x j| sSup Sx := le_csSup hbdx j, rfl have hyj : |y j| sSup Sy := le_csSup hbdy j, rfl have hcomb : |((a x + b y) j)| a * |x j| + b * |y j| := abs_component_le_convexCombo (x := x) (y := y) (a := a) (b := b) ha hb j have hmulx : a * |x j| a * sSup Sx := mul_le_mul_of_nonneg_left hxj ha have hmuly : b * |y j| b * sSup Sy := mul_le_mul_of_nonneg_left hyj hb exact le_trans hcomb (add_le_add hmulx hmuly) simpa [Sxy, Sx, Sy] using hle

Text 5.5.0.5: The function is the support function of the convex set .

Membership in the cube is equivalent to an absolute-value bound.

lemma cube_mem_iff_abs_le_one {n : Nat} {x : Fin n } : (x { x : Fin n | j, -1 x j x j 1 }) j, |x j| 1 := by constructor intro hx j exact abs_le.2 (hx j) intro hx j exact abs_le.1 (hx j)

If all components of Unknown identifier `x`x are bounded by Unknown identifier `t`sorry > 0 : Propt > 0, then Unknown identifier `x`x lies in the scaled cube.

lemma mem_scaling_cube_of_abs_le {n : Nat} {x : Fin n } {t : } (ht : 0 < t) (hxt : j, |x j| t) : x (fun y => t y) '' { x : Fin n | j, -1 x j x j 1 } := by let u : Fin n := (t) x refine u, ?_, ?_ have hu : j, |u j| (1 : ) := by intro j have ht0 : 0 t := le_of_lt (inv_pos.mpr ht) have hmul : t * |x j| t * t := by exact mul_le_mul_of_nonneg_left (hxt j) ht0 have hmul' : t * t = (1 : ) := by have htne : t 0 := ne_of_gt ht simpa using (inv_mul_cancel htne) have h1 : |u j| = t * |x j| := by simp [u, smul_eq_mul, abs_mul, abs_of_nonneg ht0] simpa [h1, hmul'] using hmul exact (cube_mem_iff_abs_le_one).2 hu have htne : t 0 := ne_of_gt ht simp [u, smul_smul, htne]

Membership in a scaled cube bounds each component in absolute value.

lemma abs_le_of_mem_scaling_cube {n : Nat} {x : Fin n } {t : } (ht : 0 t) (hx : x (fun y => t y) '' { x : Fin n | j, -1 x j x j 1 }) : j, |x j| t := by rcases hx with u, huE, rfl have hu : j, |u j| (1 : ) := (cube_mem_iff_abs_le_one).1 huE intro j have hmul : |t * u j| = t * |u j| := by simp [abs_mul, abs_of_nonneg ht] have hle : t * |u j| t * 1 := by exact mul_le_mul_of_nonneg_left (hu j) ht calc |(t u) j| = |t * u j| := by simp [smul_eq_mul] _ = t * |u j| := hmul _ t * 1 := hle _ = t := by simp

Text 5.5.1: For a function Unknown identifier `g`g, define Unknown identifier `f`sorry = sorry : Propf x = Unknown identifier `inf`inf { | (x, ) conv (epi g) }. Then Unknown identifier `f`f is called the convex hull of Unknown identifier `g`g, and is denoted .

The first projection of a finite sum of pairs is the sum of first projections.

Compare finite EReal : TypeEReal sums using pointwise bounds and nonnegative weights.

lemma sum_ereal_mul_le_sum_of_le {n m : Nat} {g : (Fin n Real) EReal} (lam : Fin m Real) (x' : Fin m (Fin n Real)) (' : Fin m Real) (h0 : i, 0 lam i) (h : i, g (x' i) (' i : EReal)) : Finset.univ.sum (fun i => ((lam i : Real) : EReal) * g (x' i)) Finset.univ.sum (fun i => ((lam i : Real) : EReal) * (' i : EReal)) := by classical refine Finset.sum_le_sum ?_ intro i hi by_cases hli : lam i = 0 simp [hli] have hpos : 0 < lam i := lt_of_le_of_ne (h0 i) (Ne.symm hli) exact ereal_mul_le_mul_of_pos_left_general (t := lam i) hpos (h i)

Coercion from : Type to EReal : TypeEReal commutes with finite sums.

A finite sum of EReal : TypeEReal terms is not : ?m.1 if each term is not : ?m.1.

lemma sum_ne_bot_of_ne_bot { : Type*} (s : Finset ) (f : EReal) (h : i s, f i ) : s.sum f := by classical revert h refine Finset.induction_on s ?_ ?_ intro h simp intro a s ha hs h have ha' : f a := h a (by simp [ha]) have hs' : s.sum f := hs (by intro i hi exact h i (by simp [hi])) have hne : f a + s.sum f := (EReal.add_ne_bot_iff).2 ha', hs' simpa [ha] using hne
